KnowledgeBase.Title: substringLE
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive substring lesser

Function.Description: The substringLE function performs a case-sensitive comparison between two substrings and determines if the first substring is lesser than or equal to the second substring. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The substringLE function performs a case-sensitive comparison between the two substrings {string1 start1 end1} and {string2 start2 end2}. If the first substring is lesser than or equal to the second substring true is returned; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: Use the substringLE function to see if the first substring is lesser than or equal to the second substring. The substringLE function makes a case-sensitive comparison of the Strings.

Syntax.Expression:
(substringLE string1 start1 end1 string2 start2 end2)

(substringLE text1 start1 end1 text2 start2 end2)

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start1
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end1
Argument.Note: The ending position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start2
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end2
Argument.Note: The ending position of the second String or Text to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first substring is lesser than or equal to the second substring, and false if second substring is greater than the first substring.
